alert.note: Alert for Kimble (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 6:54PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN KIMBLE COUNTY THROUGH 745 PM CDT... At 653 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Telegraph, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Segovia, Telegraph, South Llano River State Park, Us- 83 Near The Kerr-Kimble County Line, The Intersection Of I- 10 And Us 290, and Us-377 Near The Kimble-Edwards County Line. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 462 and 477. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for west central Texas.
